title: Live the thriller. Fun, fun fun
text: This fun day at Selvatica was the highlight of the trip. I'm soo happy we did it. The zip line was my absolute favorite. The team of workers are soo helpful, fun and professional. Thank you.

title: Impressive menu
text:
This is a great place for lunch, as you can see the nice park across. I prefered the upstairs rooms, more private and view is even better.
Service is fantastic, food is very flavorful and they offer great variety. We tried the tacos to share (rib eye and pig) organic chicken soup and cauliflower... Lamb, and jamon iberico are a must!

title: Flavors meet classy autmosphere.
text:
This is a fantastic restaurant if you are looking to impress anyone on a date, or business.
It's beautiful (the smoking area is outdoors setting with beautiful lights, not too smoky) The inside is very beautiful and classy. Food wise, the kitchen is spectacular. I order a pasta with beef ragu and fresh mint, THE BEST I EVER HAD.. my clients ordered fish and lamb, both great choices. Arugula salad with strawberries and balsamic dressing is full of flavors... dessert is a must! try the figs, canolini and the sorbet.
TIP: make sure you ask for the price of the wine before you order from the ones recommended, as they will try to sell the more expensive, nothing wrong with that, because they are delicouse, just dont be surprised with a bottle's price tag.

title: More than a five star
text: This is an amazing hotel. Amazing amenities, gym and spa. Top restaurants inside the hotel are King fish, The palm, and a French restaurant. Rooms are super spacious and clean. Staff is very professional and helpful. Many great restaurants near by, like Carolo...I will greatly recommend this hotel for business and family.

title: Excellent food and service.
text: We visited the Santa Fe location. It was for a meeting. Great idea. Food was spectacular, fresh, authentic and tasty. Service was top notch. Jonathan was attentive and knowledgeable. Thank u.

title: SIX STAR REVIEW *******
text:
Too bad there isn't a six star review. This is the best restaurant in town!
The food was exquisite. Grilled vegetables, also highly recommend the Asparagus with truffles. Lamb dish was spectacular. and they have the best wine selection. There are two areas of this restaurant, we sat in the more quiet area, more romantic. Service is amazing. Location is not centric, but worth getting here!

title: Little Italy with BIG favors
text: This is a very nice gem-restaurant. Food was fantastic. We had the lamb and fish dish. The ambiance is great and romantic. Perfect for a couples dinner.

title: Best spot for a coffee or drink
text: The coffee here is delicious. Its a beautiful place to sit and relax in the afternoon. Perfect view of the harbor. Have lunch at one of the many restaurants located alongside the board walk.

title: a Walk To Walk..
text: Get ready to experience spectacular views from the top hill of the Fortezza. Wear comfortable shoes and clothes. It's a long walk, but worth every bit. soo much history and beauty combined. Bring water too.

title: Walking distance to old times
text: Take a nice walk in the afternoon in this beautiful area. soo romantic. even though you don't get a view of sunsets on this side of town, u still get to see the beautiful colors, lots of restaurants and entertainment.

title: Real Authentic Cretan Gastronomy
text:
This is a must visit restaurant. We came here for lunch. It is fresh, flavorful, authentic and looks like family owed. It is a very casual place. The bread is first served, obviously home-made, hot. We also ordered a Greek salad, and of course a Gyro..
Cooffee is amazing. Staff is friendly and food is served fast... Bottom line...
Great service, great location, great food and service... it's a must when visiting Rethymno.

title: A must, but with a tourist guiede.
text: You must visit this spectacular site with a tourist guide. It will be worth every penny. I also recommend a small group or a personal. Otherwise the groups get too large. It's important to understand the history.

title: History explained in a modern display. Amazing
text: You must visit this amazing museum, but should do it with a tour guide. Otherwise not worth it. To much history and details to be explained.

title: Percet Location with a "But"
text: This hotel is perfectly located at a walking distance to the Acropolis (about 10-15 min walk) However, the roof terrace has a fantastic view of the NE side of the Acropolis. All the great restaurants are also at a 5 -10 min distance walk. If you are staying here, most likely you don't need a car! HERE IS THE "BUT PART" IT is also located at a noisy corner. Our room was at ground level and the misfortune of also having very noisy second floor neighbors. Poor insulation... Soo, ask for rooms on top floors. Suites are large and beautiful. Beds are super comfortable. I particularly enjoyed the delicious complementary breakfast every morning at the roof terrace with the spectacular Acropolis view.

title: Great place for a drink at sunset. best!
text: We came here with the intension to watch the sunset. had drinks only. the ambiance is fantastic. of course expect the crowds!

title: "great combination of falvors, ambiance and service"
text:
Great place to eat. We had fish and pork. The menu is amazing, many many things to chose from. House wines are good too!
Service was awesome, and to top it off, the place is very nice, large space and beautiful,... pictures included!

title: "Good choice" only needs little improvemts
text:
This is a more modern and chic, very clean hotel.. I will break down the pros and cons ..
- Location for me is everything. We chose this hotel for the great reason that ITS ON A ROAD.. In Mykonos this is very IMPORTANT. last thing you want is a hotel in the center town where you would have to stroll luggage on cobble stones.
- Hotel is 10-15 min walk to center-town. easy to get around.
- Serves a very nice breakfast daily with great option (beyond buffet style) menu options.
- Nice small pool area
- Clean
now, here are a few cons -
- The road can get a little noisy at times. but not too bad
- Staff needs to be better trained, not the friendliest, some better than others
- No shuttles provided for beaches nor city center.
DO NOT GO IN AUGUST. TOO WINDY!
Do your due diligence for the beaches, some are too expensive to rent beds.
Safe travels …

title: "Hotel was the highlight of our trip"
text:
This hotel is by far ONE of the best hotels in the world. Here is how I will break it down!
1 - Best view from all others in the Caldera
2- Best service ever! This is a very small hotel with 7-8 rooms. The service and crew go out of their way to make sure you are well taken care-off (BEST A TEAM Vasilicos 2018)
3 - Location is amazing and 10-15 min. walks to any place you need to go.
4 - This hotel is very silent and peaceful. You will appreciate that as you meditate overlooking at the sea, from your private terrace.
5 - Bathrooms are packed with fine personal-care products, EVERYTHING YOU NEED.
last, eat at the hotel, take the time to reserve a dinner one of the nights you are Here! The Chef is the best! I can still taste the grilled octopus, fresh sashimi with herbs and fish with a thyme sauce.. YUMMM!!!!!
DONT FORGET TO TIP THESE PEOPLE THAT DO SUCH A PHENOMENAL JOB!

title: The best place for a good rest.
text: This little boutique hotel is beautiful, clean and serves the best, fresh and delicious breakfast. Includes a free wine taste as well. We enjoyed the pool and Jacuzzi. The whole staff is super friendly.

title: Meal to die for
text: This is an amazing experience. You must book in advance. Order the pre fixed meal, highly recommend.

title: This restaurant does not live up to the expectations!
text: I have been to this restaurant in several occasions, but this time I had to write a review. First I must say that everything in this restaurant needs improvement. Servers are too casual, they start getting involved in the table's conversation (rude). Second, the drinks are consistently inconsistent. Food is not better than the one served at the Lobster in Santa Monica. I had called the restaurant, a manager was not available to speak to me regarding my latest birthday lunch here, but never got a call back.

title: The Best of Italian food in Venice/Los Angeles CA
text:
This place (home/converted restaurant) serves the best fresh and authentic Italian food in the area.
We tried four different dishes and all were spectacular! Black pasta with fresh crab was my fav. Leave room for dessert and be ready to drink some good wines. Services is superb. Make reservation in advance.

title: delicious lunch, and walk in the lake
text: This is a great location on the lake. Great tasty food and good service. It's a great place for both lunch and dinner. If you make it for lunch, make sure to bring comfortable walking shoes so you take a nice walk around the lake.

title: The Tasty Seafood
text: Best if you make reservations. Bar area is great. Firts come, first serve. This is a great place to eat at if you love seafood. Little pricey, but worth it. Hot fresh sourdough bread is served.

title: Great views and bar, food not soo much
text: lovely place to sit, enjoy the view and sip on a good drink. Food is not the best. Overpriced for what it is. The fish tacos are lacking flavor, very dry cabbage, fish had no salt. the Tuna salad had FOUR small strips on Tuna fish, for the price they charge, it should've had a steak (sliced)

title: Best part of this restaurant is the BAR
text: little disappointed. The menu was not very "French" the way the rack of lamb was prepared could have been done in other great Carmel restaurants.. Duck's sauce was too thick.. not my favorite.. Service wasn't the best either. Dessert was good. Flourless chocolate cake,,,,

title: Service, Service, Service.. was best!
text:
The food is ok. Paella was not my favorite. It was more of a saucy rice (too much tomato sauce) with seafood. Lamb dish was better, so was the spinach salad and bacon.
Best part was the dessert. Chocolate cake and walnuts... and like I mentioned.. The service is the BEST here... and the wine selection is also great!!

title: Flavors in every bite.
text: This restaurant is unique in every way. Make sure to make reservations and get ready for a real treat. Every dish is explosive, from the pastas to chicken tandoori salad. It's a cute cozy place. House converted to a restaurant. Patio is my favorite area to sit on a nice warm lunch day.

title: Modern hotel in the ancient Rome
text: This hotel has a perfect location. 15 min walk from the train station (but I highly recommend getting a cab) the ancient roman roads can be tough on your luggage wheels. Also conveniently located only 15 min. walk from Coliseum & ancient Rome. This hotel has a beautiful roof top restaurant that serves delicious food and coffee. or just go up and have a drink there. Staff is great and friendly. Special Thanks to Mr. Federico Pacini, hotel manager. From the Daskalov's

title: You havent seeing Rome untill you visit the Colosseum.
text: Make sure to buy a tour. Worth every penny. You also avoid great lines. Nothing better than having an expert explain everything about this magnificent place. Its about 2-3 hrs. so wear comfortable shoes.

title: Simply impacting. History at it's best!
text: This tour was not even on our schedule. From our drive to Sorrento it was highly recommended that we stopped by our driver. Soo glad we listened. We didn't not have the time to take the tour, but I strongly recommend you do. It's worth if you have a couple hours to spear. Also, FYI. The small restaurants surrounding this area offer the best fast food, sandwiches, salads and pizza..

title: A great place for an early drink
text: This is a beautiful hotel with a stunning view, best if you go before sunsets. We did not stay her, but did have the pleasure of dinning here. I honestly LOVED the food, but was a bit disappointed after. I should have read the menu before reserving. I wanted to be "Wowed" by high-end Italian cuisine and did not find it here, but do go here for drinks. Very romantic setting..

title: If you are looking for "Real Italian food" come here!
text: Simply THE BEST ITALINA FOOD in Rome.. Make sure to make a reservation. It's a smaller restaurant on the same road and close to the Trevi Fountain. Kill two birds with one stone! Service is amazing. Samuelle was the best. We had pizza and pasta of course. Seafood was also great (grilled dishes) everything looked amazing so you can not go wrong with what you order.

title: great area to take a stroll, shop and have coffee.
text: We took the time to stroll and do a little shopping here. We also had afternoon coffee and Gelatoo (of course)

title: Making a wish here is a must
text: Super crowed place, but it's a must visit when in Rome! perfect place for selfies. surrounded by many great restaurants. Time your visit here so you can either have lunch or dinner in the area.

title: This is "the best spot"
text:
Definitely a WOW moment walking into this beautiful square..
Architecture like you've never seeing before. Make sure to purchase the inexpensive tour into the Duomo. Avoid lines and get all the details about this majestic place.

title: Must visit in theSummer!
text: Villa Cimbrone and Villa Rufolo (13th century) are all magnificent sights. Amalfi Coast cities are a must, but best during Summer. Many of the attractions in the area are closed. Ravello is the smallest city in the coast. You can actually walk through the whole town in a few minutes.

title: Real taste of Florence. Florentine steak, best ever!
text: The food here is the best! Florentine steak is the way to go. This is a small quaint restaurant with a great patio. Tony was an amazing server. Recommended some very good local wines. This restaurant is not only amazing in every regard, it is also very affordable!

title: The Better side of Capri
text: Marina Piccola is the calmer, most beautiful side of Capri. From the harbor take a taxi. Its only 15 min. away. You will find great restaurants and you can swim there as well.. It's breathtaking.

title: Location is everyting when traveling.
text:
This small boutique Hotel is perfectly and center located. It's on the main tourist shopping alley, small shops that offer everything from leather goods & souvenirs to delicious fruits and vegetables and great restaurants to dine at. Its at a 5 - 8 min. walk from the marina and two steps away from the main square where you can find amazing restaurants and coffee shops .. YES, Gelato too!!!
What really impressed me about this restaurant was the amazing breakfast buffet that they offer every morning, complementary. Includes a great variety of fresh tasty fruits and veggies from the owners garden, eggs, cold cuts, sweetie pastries... WAY MORE THAN AN AMERICAN continental breakfast for sure.. This hotel is family owned and ran by the family. great service..

title: This is the company you should book with!
text: Amalfi coast is SIMPLY THE BEST! Margharita was the contact person. She made the whole process simple, as we had no idea how to go about it. She is not only efficient in quickly responding to all emails and questions, but she is very honest and knowledgeable. We arrived in Naples and headed to Pompei (It's a must) Tatziana picked us up, she was very efficient and accommodating. it was easy to locate her in the craziness of the train station. The next day we booked a trip to Amalfi Coast. Genaro was our driver, he was fluent in English and very patient with us as we toured the coast all day in a comfortable limo. The breath taking towns of Positano, Amalfi and Ravello simply amazing. Genaro knows all the great restaurants for lunch. He suggested an amazing one for us,,, I loved this tour and can not wait to do it again.

title: amazing little gems ..
text: It just kept getting better as we drove through the Amalfi Coast, from Amalfi to Ravello to Positano...

title: Bites of heavly flavors
text: This is a Gelato Gem place.. all locals go there, but it has become soo popular that everyone now goes there.. All flavors are amazing... we came here every day while in Sorrento!

title: Beyond our expectations
text:
My husband and I stayed at this great hotel. Celebrating our first year anniversary. The staff (Especially Elena) was wonderful accommodating us in a great room! Very modern, newly renovated, breakfast included. buffet style.
Perfectly located 10-15 min walk from the train station and 5-8 min walk from the Duomo. Also very conveniently located near the Galleria (10 min walk) Ask the helpful staff for dinning recommendations, as they are very knowledge and will suggest the best places to eat. Our best meals were here, Florence..

title: View over the Top "literally"
text: It's a very long up-hill walk. If you are not in good shape I strongly recommend to take a ride. The view is stunning.

title: Visiting the Duomo with a "Guide" is the best way!
text: I am very happy we decided to pay the little extra fee and enter the Duomo with a Guide. First of all, you avoid the waiting in line and second, there is nothing better than entering these magnificent places and learning the whole story behind it. other way, just walking through does it NO justice. Annalisa Menconi was the best! Thank You.

title: The "Galleria" MichelAngelo's David with a guide is a must.
text: The Galleria is a must visit while in Florence. I strongly recommend a guide. They are very knowledgeable and take the time to answer all questions. Cecilia was a great communicator. Very patient with all the questions asked. You also avoid the huge lines. The fees are worth it. no doubt!

title: Like being in heaven.
text: Its amazing to see in person what men have been creating for hundreds and hundreds of years. God was a Huge inspiration for all these great creators. simply stunning.
place: Duomo - Cattedrale di Santa Maria del Fiore

title: Perfect, Perfect, Perfect....
text: This small boutique hotel is perfectly located. it was a little smaller of a hotel than I expected, but had great rooms with fantastic views. Breakfast is included (expect more than a continental one) They take pride in service... We walked everywhere from here. St. Peter square is only 10 min away.. everything else is at walking distance (Shopping areas restaurants..etc.. )

title: Another reason to love Venice
text: This restaurant was my favorite while in Venice. We had our first Italian meal here. I could not believe the difference between real Italian food and what we eat in USA. all ingredients are fresh and tasty. Great wine selections! We had the branzino, Melon and prosciutto.. Rosario and his team of servers were very helpful and amazing! the Tiramisu is a must for dessert!!

title: Real pasta. The Italian Way!
text: I am not much of a pasta eater, till I was in Italy, ate the real thing. Italians have a way of making simple foods like pizza and pasta taste incredible, different... FRESH!

title: Perfect place for a drink
text:
After our gondola ride we accidently bumped into this luxurious hotel. I'm very glad we did. the setting is very romantic as we watched the sunset setting to gondola riders, at grand canal.
service was great and the drinks even better!
place: The Gritti Palace, a Luxury Collection Hotel

title: Does not get worst than this...
text: I have stayed in many hotels in Santa Barbara. This is the far one of the worst hotels in town. Where do I begin.. This Hotel is part of the Hyatt Santa Barbara which is a block and a half away from this building, this is where you register so you must go back and forth "walking" (its ok if you don't mind it! The rooms are very OLD, everything is very outdated... Walls are like paper thin. I can hear people upstairs urinating in the middle of the night... Just avoid this place in general till they remodel it... LONG OVER DUE!!!

title: Perfect Location. Steps away from everything.
text: This is a very nice boutique Hotel. It is perfectly located in the French Quarter near everything. 18 of us traveled, from the whole group, my husband and I were the ones that apparently made the best choice. Only half away from Bourbon street and two steps away from Royal St ( a lot of boutiques here) I also enjoyed the complementary breakfast. It was great. lots of options, better than continental.. Rooms are very spacious. beds are very comfortable...

title: The real treat...
text: Having a beignet from this place was like biting into a fluffy cloud of sweetness and divinity.. even though they are very busy, the line goes by fast. service is great. Look for siting in the adjacent patio if needed.. I missed it, wish I would have seeing it,

title: It's all about the "Experience" food is amazing...
text: Fine dinning is not only about the unique flavors, but a combination of great bites and service experience. Special thanks to Cory, One of our great servers. R'evolution has all these elements. Save room for dessert. It's a must.

title: This bar is worth "The Spin"
text: This is a classy bar, inside the Monteleone Hotel. Great ambiance, amazing drinks and best Bloody Mary's.

title: Fancier, but most reasonable.
text: We came here with a huge group of 15 people. Rene, the manager was great at accommodating us and our needs. Prices are very reasonable and food is excellent.. From great seafood dishes to burgers and salads, they have something in the menu for everyone.

title: Perfect bites of southern foods.
text: This café was definitely one of my favorite places while visiting. Prices are reasonable and food is authentic and delicious. They offer a great variety, from chicken and waffles to Cajun fish and French toast.. bites of heaven...
